On Thu, 21 Feb 2002, Chris Eppstein <ceppstein@...> wrote:
> From: Stefan Bodewig [mailto:bodewig@...]
>> Basically yes - but you should probably ask that on
>> ant-user@...
> 
> It's the _JUnit_ task... This seems like a decent place to ask the
> question :-) If you ask it there, they'll probably send them our
> way...

Probably not (note that I am part of *they* in your statement and one
of the initial authors of Ant's JUnit task 8-).

It is a built-in task in Ant, and JUnit itself doesn't use it in its
own build file, JUnit spawns the text-UI TestRunner in a java task.

> maybe the solution is to offer both options. i.e. You could set
> fork="no", "once", or "always". or something along those lines.

With "true" being an alias for "always" for backwards compatibility?
That would work, yes.

Stephane Bailliez is currently working on a reimplementation of that
task (it really needs some heave refactoring) and I think his
implementation will always be forked and be equivalent to the "once"
case above - I'll have to check.

Stefan
